properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 16 at 8:36AM CST until January 16 at 10:30AM CST by NWS Fort Worth TX
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Fort Worth has issued a

* Flood Advisory for...
North central Dallas County in north central Texas...

* Until 1030 AM CST.

* At 835 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms that were
producing heavy rainfall across north central Dallas County.
Excessive runoff from these thunderstorms will cause urban and
small stream flooding. Areas that are low lying or usually
experience poor drainage are most likely to experience flooding.
This means some low water crossings in the region may become
impassable. Up to two inches of rain have already fallen.

* Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Dallas, Garland, Richardson, University Park, Addison, Highland
Park and Buckingham.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of small
creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as
well as other drainage areas and low lying spots.
